subject: Swiggy Q2 results, Mazagon Dock's first stock split, & more - Groww Digest
body:
Groww Digest
3 December, 2024
Sensex80,845.75 ▲ 0.74%

Nifty24,457.15 ▲ 0.75%

Nifty 50
24,457.15 +181.10 [1-day]


💡 Nifty 50 has risen between 0% and 1% about 469 times in the last 5 years.

Nifty 50 opened slightly above yesterday’s closing point.

Stocks rose almost throughout the day.

Media and bank stocks rose the most today. FMCG stocks fell the most.

Global markets: most American, European, and Asian markets were up.

Top Gainers
NIFTY 50
Adani PortsRs 1,288.65▲ 5.99%

NTPCRs 367.45▲ 2.58%

Adani EnterprisesRs 2,514.20▲ 2.33%

L&TRs 3,787.05▲ 2.24%

SBIRs 853.95▲ 2.10%
Top Losers
NIFTY 50
AirtelRs 1,620.55▼ 1.40%

Hero MotoRs 4,697.00▼ 1.08%

HDFC LifeRs 634.00▼ 0.97%

ITCRs 472.55▼ 0.97%

Sun PharmaRs 1,800.05▼ 0.47%

News

  • Suraksha Diagnostic IPO was subscribed 1.27 times. Retail subscription: 0.94 times. Closed for subscription.

Stocks Updates
  • ONGC: has invested Rs 10,501 crore to increase its stake from 94.57% to 95.69% in its subsidiary ONGC Petro additions Limited (OPaL).

  • Adani Ports: reported a 21% year-on-year rise in cargo volume to 36 million metric tonnes in November. ​​The company managed 293.7 million metric tonnes for the year-to-date period ending November (a 7% year-on-year increase).

  • Tata Power: has commissioned a 431 MW solar project at Neemuch in Madhya Pradesh. The company claimed that the project is likely to offset an estimated 7,80,300 tonnes of CO2.

  • Swiggy: reported a 4.8% year-on-year fall in net loss to Rs 625.53 crore in the July-Sept quarter. The board has also approved an investment of up to Rs 1,600 crore in Scootsy Logistics, a company subsidiary.

  • Mazagon Dock: has fixed 27 December for its 1:2 stock split. This is the first time in the company's trading history that it has announced such a corporate action.

  • Solar Industries: has received international orders worth Rs 2,039 crore to supply defence products which are to be delivered over the next 4 years.

  • Godrej Properties: has raised Rs 6,000 crore through a QIP (Qualified Institutional Placement). The QIP issue was subscribed over 4 times. This amount was raised by diluting 7.68% of equity.

  • Ola Electric: has announced an expansion of its store network from 800 to 4,000 by 20 December.

Word of the Day
Open Market Operations


OMOs are activities conducted by a central bank (RBI) to control the supply of money in the economy

Central banks do this by buying and selling government bonds and securities in the open market.

OMO is usually used to control inflation.

Example: the RBI sells government bonds to banks or the public. The buyers (banks or investors) pay money to the RBI for these bonds.

This reduces the amount of cash in the banking system, which helps control inflation by reducing spending in the economy.

6 Day Course
Theme: understanding volatility

MonTueWedThuFriSun

Let’s look at an example.

Stock ABC’s price is Rs 20 at 9 am; Rs 18 at 1 pm, and Rs 20 at 3:30 pm.

Stock XYZ’s price is Rs 20 at 9 am; Rs 12 at 1 pm, and Rs 20 at 3:30 pm.

Practically speaking, both the stocks' prices are the same in the morning and at closing time.

But clearly, stock XYZ is a lot more volatile.

If you own both these stocks, selling XYZ will be more challenging than selling ABC.

So, in this case, we can see that this volatility is adding some risk to us.

This is a reason why higher volatility is seen as more risky.


Missed last week's course? You can download the course PDF - click to download
Featured Question
Q. “How is the tax calculated if I have bought 1000 rupees worth fund 2 yrs ago and then bought 1000 rupees worth fund 2 months age and sell 800 rupees worth of the fund, does mutual fund house follow FIFO method? (For easy understanding let's assume the fund is index fund)”
A. You are right — FIFO is followed.

FIFO = First In First Out.

Using FIFO, older mutual fund units are sold first. This allows taxes to be lowered.

This is true in the case of all kinds of funds — equity, debt, hybrid, index, FOF, etc.
